title: A look at the support role and why I get depressed.
body:
I love dominating a game as a Lulu, or Leona, or any of my other strong supports but at the end of a great victory I'm left nothing to show for it. I don't get a good K/D spread or any cs, I don't even get some end game statistics. no "effective CC done" no "wards placed" no "damage shielded"... There is almost nothing in the history or after game report that tells anyone I did well. AND, being that I'm the support i very rarely get verbal recognition. Honestly it really slaps the smile off my face when the end game chat is all about our Carry like i wasn't even there. 

Now I know a lot of this is due to a poor community of players, and maybe people in general not giving a good pat on the back, but can't Riot do something about this? Can i get some number somewhere that tells me I Supported that game and rocked! Can I get a number of times I saved someones life so that I can recognize it even if they don't?

Show the Support some love please.

Just a thought.

replies.body:
Supports can be under appreciated. It's true you don't necessarily have anything to show for efforts. But take heart. Your wards make a difference, your self-sacrifice makes a difference, and your dedication to protecting your carry and your team makes a difference. I don't know if there is anything in the works to show supports more love but I do know that as a great support player your contributions are known — not only by yourself. 

Great ADCs know they'd die without you.
Great Junglers know they'll rely on you.
Great Mids look to you for protection.
Great Toplaners lean on your synergy to survive.

I play support pretty often and my personal code is generally this:

“A great man is always willing to be little.” 
―* Ralph Waldo Emerson*

Except that's not what Riot said that it wanted from a support.  I play a lot of Support myself, Started in Season three.  Now, I can only place a total of four wards on the map, one of them always visible.  The rest of my team buys trinkets, and maybe one might place one during laning, but then the second it's over, it's up to me, with my four wards, to somehow cover the entire map's vision needs. Dragon, baron, their jungle, our jungle, escape routes, invade routes, backdoor routes, everything.  I can't do that anymore.  Do I have enough gold? Hell yeah I do! It's just a pity that I can't spend all that gold on what my team really needs, which is a babysitter to place their wards for them.  Then riot gets mad when a Support does their job too well, E.G. Sona, and continually nerfs them into oblivion.  Sona was the perfect support, then she was nerfed, then changed, then nerfed some more for good measure.  She can't go mid because she lacks damage now, and she can't protect and sustain properly, because her W's AP scaling was trashed with no good reason or QoL improvements to make her any better.

Then we get into the other problem.  Burst mages who get shunted into the support role because they can do it better.  In season 3, it was Annie and Zyra, and they've only gotten worse with the new gold improvements for supports.  Meanwhile, traditional supports like Janna, or Nami have to struggle to keep up because of increasing mana costs on a low budget, and no AP ratios to Justify the hits they've had to take.  Should Nami's bubble do half of an ADC's HP in one shot? No, but it should sting, same thing with Janna's tornadoes or W, both of which feel early like they lack any power, and lategame like they should hit like a truck, but by this point in the game, everyone's got Resistances and Lifesteal for sustain, meaning that any impact that they have is completely negated.

I've taken to countering the Burst-Mage epidemic in botlane with champions like Shen and Galio, both amazing in their own roles, but in bot, they can actually take the huge amounts of burst that Champions like Annie, Zyra, and even (God save us) Ahri can provide.  

I don't know where in Riot's structure you happen to call home.


But, and this is coming from the bottom of my heart.

Please, look at Supports, look at the role, and sit down, and ask yourselves. Where do you want this role to go into the future? Because at this rate, your Traditional Support Archetypes are going to get phased out for something new at every turn, and that's honestly just a shame, because it is, and can be, the most difficult and rewarding role to play.  I love supporting, but when the game can't give me the tools that the role requires, I'm just going to move on.


Remove the ward cap on Green wards, or at least make it bigger if you take the support role. Do like you did with Machete and Smite, but with Exhaust for all I care.  

Reduce the amount of Gold given for Assists and just sitting in lane with the Amulet.  Make Amulet more than just a holding-pattern item and make it a little more involved, like the Spelltheif's edge or the relic shield.

Bring the skill back to supporting, bring the niche back home, make it less generic and more enjoyable for everyone involved, please riot.

I main support, and I always feel like the ADC's success is my success as well. If my ADC has an amazing K/D/A and my assists are above 20, I know I've done my job well. However, I feel like ADC's deserve their credit. They have to focus on CS, avoid being focused in team fights, prioritize targets, etc.

I feel like bot lane is sort of like dance partners. The support is like the male dancer that has to be the muscle to lift up the female dancer to do these amazing moves. However, the female that is being spun around must have the COURAGE to follow through, and know that her partner is there to  support her through those flashy death defying acts. It's the same with the support/adc relationship. You really need both to do well for an ADC to shine.

I main support too, and i really think that these changes need to be made.
I was playing a game as thresh and my ADC + mid walked into a 2v5 near drag. I ran away and they got mad because they died and i didnt sacrifice myself for them. they said "A support's life is worth less than an adc's" They walked into another 2v5 and i decided to try and slow the enemy team down. My adc and mid survived but i died, but a few seconds later they said something like "report thresh for feeding" 

A few games later i was karma support and it was about 30:00 into the game. My jungler was pushing bot so i decided to take wolves for some extra gold, and suddenly my entire team (Not exaggerated) got mad and said "Supports dont need gold" or "That's the jungler's farm" 

I dont think that there necessarily needs to be a stat in the end-game screen for wards of damage shielded, (although it would help a lot) I think the idea of a 'support' needs to be changed all together. Most people that dont play support think of the support as some useless teammate there to get the adc fed. That's generally the point of the support, but when it gets to the point where teammates treat you like a useless slave, something needs to be changed. Supports need to be moved from the 'help the adc then be useless' role to the 'help the adc then proceed to help carry later' type of role. I understand some supports bring massive cc to teamfights but nobody acknowledges  that contribution usually. Ive started playing lux support because she can help in the lane phase and still bring damage to a teamfight, but i really want to play tankier supports like thresh and leona. Why should i have to chose between having fun and not getting yelled at by my team?
